intro: Dichapetalum griseisepalum, commonly known as the gray-sepaled dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
